document_data.name: Hamadryad Egg
document_data.mainbody: '''''Hamadryad eggs''''' were stones used as a [[holy symbol]] by worshipers of [[Silvanus|the Treefather]].{{Cite dragon/412/Channel Divinity: Chauntea and Silvanus|24-25}}
document_data.Description: ''Hamadryad eggs'' were white egg-shaped stones bearing a carved symbol representing an oak leaf. The carving would turn green when used by a faithful to focus [[divine magic]].
document_data.Powers: Some ''eggs'' were known to empower the casting abilities of their users, and granted them limited teleportation abilities.
document_data.History: The first ''egg'' was carved by a [[cleric]] of Silvanus, who offered it as a joke to [[Metiai]], a [[hamadryad]]. It was said that on the night of the next full moon, she gave the cleric the stone back imbued with potent enchantments.
